title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons         Park Visitor Center decorated for 4th of July. NPS photo  Visitor Center  Visitor Center is from May-September daily: 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM. Located on the corner of 2nd and Broadway in the Skagway Historic District in the former White Pass & Yukon Route depot.  The Visitor Center is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome. There are public restrooms in the Visitor Center. Note:  during the winter you can view the park film or ask a ranger questions by stopping by the park administrative office front desk.        Maintenance staff decorate the exterior of the Museum & Administrative Building for the 4th of July. NPS photo  Park Museum & Administrative Offices The park museum is located on the ground floor of our administrative building next to the Visitor Center at 2nd and Broadway. The museum is closed until late August 2016 for restoration and new exhibits.  We look forward to experiencing new, accessible exhibits in the museum later this year.  This museum is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome.    Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park's Administrative Offices are located upstairs from the park museum. Administrative Office Hours: Mon. - Fri. 8 AM - 5 PM year round.          Interpretive Ranger converses with visitors outside of the restored Mascot saloon. NPS photo  Mascot Saloon Museum Visit an authentic post-gold rush saloon museum with displays and exhibits. Open daily early May - late September 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM Located on the corner of 3rd and Broadway in the Skagway Historic District. This facility is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome. There are public restrooms in this building.        The historic Pantheon Saloon is open every summer as the Junior Ranger Activity Center. NPS photo  Pantheon Saloon & Jr. Ranger Activity Center Located in the restored Pantheon Saloon building, the Jr. Ranger Activity Center provides educational, tactile, interactive experiences in a fun, family friendly environment.  Open early May - late September. Monday - Friday: 10 AM - 12 PM & 1 PM - 3 PM Located on the corner of 4th and Broadway in the Skagway Historic District. This facility is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome.         The Moore Homestead is a quiet place to visit when touring the Skagway Historic District. NPS photo  Moore House Exhibit See exhibits in this restored home of Skagway's first homesteading family. Open daily early May - mid September 10 AM - 4:30 PM Located at 5th and Spring in the Skagway Historic District. This facility is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome. This building does not have restrooms.        NPS photo  Chilkoot Trail Center Registration and information center for the Chilkoot International Trail. Stop by to get your Chilkoot Trail Permit, see the bear awareness video, and get your trail orientation.  During the off-season, these services are available at the Park Administrative Offices, located at 2nd and Broadway. Open daily June 1 - Labor Day weekend 8 AM - 5 PM Located on Broadway between 5th and 6th in the Skagway Historic District.  This facility is wheelchair accessible and service animals are welcome. This building does not have public restrooms.        Aerial view of Dyea Campground NPS image  Dyea Campground Located 9 miles outside of Skagway via gravel access road. More information is available on our Campgrounds page.  Open daily year-round, when free of snow. Contact the park for current conditions.
